ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Learned a great deal about renewable energy, autonomous vehicles, computers, medical advances, and other cutting-edge technology.
Energy and various other topics!
I learned about a wide range of policy-relevant technological developments, such as desalination, renewable energy, and minimally invasive surgery technologies.
Learned a lot about sustainability and how the future of environmentally friendly technology works
I really expanded my (previously non-existent) knowledge on the technology in public policy. This ranged from power plants to electric vehicles.
basic public policy
Knowledge about modern scientific advancements and their history

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Strengths: the material was very interesting, Professor Prober was a good lecturer and an interesting person, and the assignments helped me learn; Weaknesses: the 195 minute lectures can be very long, especially in the morning, but Professor Prober gives us a very reasonable number of breaks

Strengths:
-Wide range of topics covered effectively.
-Engaging, knowledgeable and compassionate instructor. 
-Group project allowed for a deeper dive into our particular interests. 
Weaknesses:
-Individual sessions can be a bit draining, could benefit from three shorter classes each week rather than two longer ones.
Lectures were all over the place and often times there was a very strange connection between one discussion and the next

The course has a very passionate professor who is supported by a helpful TA. There are a nice number of guest lectures. 
I would wish that classes could be shorter, as 3 hours is simply too long for many students. Also, the grading can be very harsh.
so much repetitive lecture
The class was a bit boring, especially over zoom, but the guest lecturers were interesting. It could be improved by adding more interactive components like break out rooms or experiments.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes. It wasn't too challenging, but the professor and course content are both great
Yes! A really good low-stress survey of topics in technology and public policy. Professor Prober is super understanding and passionate about the material.
Definitely, especially for policy-oriented students, such as Economics or Polysci majors, looking for an interesting science credit.
Yes but only if you need a science credit

I would recommend this for students seeking a science class with accessible materials. The final project is fair and there are no assignments that will surprise you with how much work. It is also very difficult to fall behind, which is nice. Just make sure to do a good job, as there are not that many assignments and they may be graded harshly. Also the curve is unfortunate.
if you need a science credit
Only if you really need a science credit. It's essentially a lecture course, and during the summer every class is over 3 hours long so it can be hard to get through.

narratives.question_text: The Canvas course site allowed me to identify and access required course materials easily.
comments: Strongly Agree
Strongly Agree
Strongly Agree
